text:
Hello dear community !
I don't understand how to resolve this error when I'm submitting a template pack
*Kili Homepage 2: CSS classes can’t be applied to standard WYSIWYG content.*
It's a little difficult to know which module is responsible
completely taking a  educated guess here. Try looking for a rich text field that is not a field in a module.

Hello <@U7SL518D6> hope you're well :slightly_smiling_face: Very strange I have no Rich Text (hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text) in my template. My template just adds *custom modules* and I'm using VALUE and not SNIPPET inside my CM

huh, interesting, I’m sure you already did it, but check the custom modules in your template to see if you have class names inside of any rich text or standard text fields. I would think that since the issue is occuring at the template level it’s likely that the issue is with a template default setting and not the custom module’s defaults
I found the source ! It was a default text in a Rich Text Element in a Custom Module that contains a class in a list ... difficult to find it :slightly_smiling_face:
